Takengon is a remote city in the middle of the north Sumatra highlands. It is famous for its fish and coffee and for being close to the beautiful Laut Tawar Lake, which is well worth a visit.
By arriving from south you have to get a minibus in

. The buses depart in the early day until about 11:00. Ask at the bus station in Kutancane.
By arriving from the north you either can go directly from
. There is a shared taxi service departing in the early morning or late evenings from Banda Aceh.
There is a taxi service in the city. Most of the taxis are based on motorcykle, they take you basically all over the city very cheap.
As the city is fairly small it is very walkable.

value: , walk to the lakefront to see the fishing villages. Starting in the morning you can walk all the 25 kilometres to the other end. If you go on a Sundays, you will have company, as the whole region goes to the lake to party and to relax.
, a famous place for gathering. It is big and charming, with a wide selection of items available.

Coffee, the area is famous for the Takengon Sumatra Coffee. You can buy the coffee at the market and in small stores.
Fish from Laut Tawar, you can find small street food restaurants at the bus station. They cook fairly good indonesian food, make sure you eat the fish which is delicious.
